Lyrics: Como Santa María guariu o crérigo que se lle tornaran as pérnas atrás porque fez ũus panos mẽores dun pano que furtou de sôbelo altar.
Direct Translation: How Holy Mary cured the priest whose legs tunred backward because he made undergarments from a cloth he stole from the altar.

Lyrics: Porque ben Santa María | sabe os séus dões dar,
Direct Translation: Because Holy Mary wisely bestows Her gifts,
Poetic Translation: Since the Holy Virgin Mary Gives Her gifts, astute and wise,

Lyrics: muito per faz gran folía | quen lle vai o séu furtar.
Direct Translation: he who would steal something of Hers is very foolhardy indeed.
Poetic Translation: He who steals from Her is very Foolish in the Virgin's eyes.

Lyrics: Onde, se m' oír quisérdes, | daquesto vos contarei
Direct Translation: Wherefore, if you will hear me, I shall tell you
Poetic Translation: On this topic, if you'll hear me, Here's a wonder dazzling

Lyrics: un miragre mui fremoso | que fez a Madre do Rei
Direct Translation: a very beautiful miracle concerning this which the Mother
Poetic Translation: That Saint Mary, Jesus' Mother, Did to Odemira bring.

Lyrics: Jesú-Crist' en Odimira, | como vos óra direi,
Direct Translation: of Jesus Christ performed in Odemira, as I shall tell you now.
Poetic Translation: Of Her works in that good city Gratefully the people sing;

Lyrics: u ela fez ende muitos | outros en aquel logar.
Direct Translation: She has performed many other miracles in that place.
Poetic Translation: Many wonders She has made there, But this one would take the prize.

Lyrics: Mas este foi muit' apósto | e feito con gran razôn;
Direct Translation: However, this one was very fitting and done with good reason.
Poetic Translation: It was fitting, done with reason, Just as She is always just.

Lyrics: ca ũa mollér séu pano | foi dar en ofereçôn
Direct Translation: A woman gave a cloth she had in offering
Poetic Translation: Once a woman gave some fabric As an offering in trust

Lyrics: a ũa eigreja súa, | feita des mui gran sazôn,
Direct Translation: to a church of Holy Mary which was built a long time ago
Poetic Translation: To a church of Holy Mary, Ancient as the region's dust,

Lyrics: que está fóra da vila, | assí com' oí contar.
Direct Translation: and stands outside the town, as I heard tell.
Poetic Translation: Standing on the city's outskirts Under Andalusian skies.

Lyrics: Pouco mais ca ũa vara | o pan' éra, com' oí,
Direct Translation: The cloth measured a little more than a vara*, as I heard,
Poetic Translation: It was just about a vara, Longer than a person's arm.

Lyrics: e éra mui ben teçudo | e mui delgad' outrossí;
Direct Translation: and was delicate and finely woven.
Poetic Translation: It was thin and finely woven, Made with elegance and charm,

Lyrics: e porend' a mollér bõa | fora-o põer alí
Direct Translation: Therefore, the good woman had placed it there
Poetic Translation: And therefore, this helpful woman Placed it safely out of harm

Lyrics: na eigreja, u o vissen | estar sôbelo altar.
Direct Translation: in the church where it could be seen and spread over the altar.
Poetic Translation: As an altar cloth for Mary, Since it was the perfect size.

Lyrics: Un crérigo da eigreja | que o viu alí seer,
Direct Translation: A priest of the church who saw it there
Poetic Translation: At the church, a priest was working, Saw the altar so arrayed.

Lyrics: creceu-ll' ên tal cobiíça | que o foi lógu' ên toller,
Direct Translation: began to covet it so greatly that he stole it
Poetic Translation: He began to covet greatly That fine cloth where it was laid.

Lyrics: e levou-o a sa casa | e mandou ende fazer
Direct Translation: and took it to his house and had undergarments
Poetic Translation: So he stole it from the altar, Brought it home, and ordered made

Lyrics: panos con que cobriss' ende | o con que ía pecar.
Direct Translation: made from it with which to cover his sinful parts.
Poetic Translation: Underpants to cover up his Naughty parts from people's eyes.

Lyrics: E pois que os ouve feitos | e con eles se cobriu,
Direct Translation: After he had them made and put them on,
Poetic Translation: When the underpants were finished And he went and tried them on,

Lyrics: deitava-s' a dormir lógo; | mais pero pouco dormiu,
Direct Translation: he lay down to sleep, but he slept very little,
Poetic Translation: He lay down for peaceful slumber, But he could not even yawn.

Lyrics: ca os calcannares ambos | pelos lombos os sentiu
Direct Translation: for he felt both his heels pressing into his loins
Poetic Translation: When he closed his eyes, it pierced him, And it kept him up till dawn:

Lyrics: que ll' entraron tan de rijo | que os non pod' ên tirar.
Direct Translation: so tightly that he could not pull them out.
Poetic Translation: Both his legs were bending backward Till his heels dug in his thighs.

Lyrics: E con mui gran coita féra | que avía de door,
Direct Translation: In the great distress he had from this pain,
Poetic Translation: Screaming in distress and anguish, He cried out with all his might,

Lyrics: braadou muit' e dizendo: | "Ai, Madre do Salvador,
Direct Translation: he cried out loudly, saying: "Oh, Mother of the Savior,
Poetic Translation: "Oh, fair Mother of the Savior, Do not let me die tonight!"

Lyrics: rógo-te que éu non moira | assí, se t' ên prazer for."
Direct Translation: I beg you not to let me die like this, if it so please you,"
Poetic Translation: He began a full confession With a countenance contrite

Lyrics: E do érro que fezéra | fillou-s' a mãefestar
Direct Translation: and he began to confess the error he had committed
Poetic Translation: Of the sin that he committed In sincere, despairing cries.

Lyrics: Ante todos, e chorando | ar fillou-s' a repentir,
Direct Translation: so that all present might now. Weeping, he began to repent
Poetic Translation: All those present heard his error, And they saw his weeping face.

Lyrics: e dun gran pano de lenço | fez lóg' o altar cobrir.
Direct Translation: and had the altar covered at once with a large linen cloth.
Poetic Translation: He, in full repentance, called for Linen fabric to be placed

Lyrics: E porende, méus amigos, | quen este miragr' oír
Direct Translation: Therefore, my friends, may anyone who hears this miracle
Poetic Translation: On the altar, so it would be Covered as befit its grce.

Lyrics: nunca seja atrevudo | ena Virgen desonrrar.
Direct Translation: never be so bold as to dishonor the Virgin.
Poetic Translation: So, my friends, if you can hear me, Don't debase the Queen on High.

Lyrics: E sobr' esto à eigreja | o levaron manamán,
Direct Translation: Then they took him quickly to the church,
Poetic Translation: To the church they took him quickly Through the pain that he endured,

Lyrics: e todos por el rogaron | a Sennor do bon talán;
Direct Translation: and all prayed for him to the Lady of Goodwill.
Poetic Translation: Praying Heaven's Queen to aid him, And the Goodwill Lady heard.

Lyrics: e ela guariu-o lógo, | que non prendeu i afán;
Direct Translation: She cured him at once so that he suffered no ill effects.
Poetic Translation: Holy Virgin Mary listened, And he was completely cured.

Lyrics: porên todos começaron | o séu nome de loar.
Direct Translation: Therefore, all began to praise Her name.
Poetic Translation: All the people sang Her praises, Raised Her name up to the skies.

Lyrics: Alfonso X el Sabio, King of Castile and León
